doc.repnme: Multilateral Investment Guarantee Agency (MIGA) 2006 annual report : executive summary
doc.abstracts: This executive summary of the Annual Report records the achievements of the Multilateral Investment Guarantee Agency during fiscal year 2006. MIGA's investment insurance, dispute mediation services, and technical assistance generated strong results this fiscal year. The agency issued 66 guarantees totaling $1.3 billion for 34 new projects and 7 projects previously supported, for a total of 41 projects. In fiscal year 2006, the Solomon Islands and Antigua and Barbuda joined MIGA, bringing the agency's membership to 167. Besides fiscal highlights, this report presents Board activities and MIGA's development impact in frontier markets. Other operational highlights include, together with the World Bank, implemented investment promotion activities in Afghanistan, Armenia, Bangladesh, Cambodia, China, Guatemala, Honduras, Mali, Mozambique, Nicaragua, Serbia and Tajikistan. Conducted joint technical assistance work with IFC in China and the Philippines. No claims were paid in fiscal year 2006. There are three claims pending for investments in Argentina and the Kyrgyz Republic. Successfully mediated a dispute involving a water investment in China, the project is now providing potable water for 450,000 people.
